intro: Clutia rubricaulis var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaved clutia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant has thin, elongated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for cultivation in tropical gardens.
